snippet: Protesters condemned the national laboratory here, which produced the first atomic bombs 70 years ago but also remains the town’s economic lifeblood.
abstract: Los Alamos Journal; New Mexico's Los Alamos National Laboratory has become target of different perspectives on high tech and classified work being carried out there; lab continues to draw protests against its origins as development site for nuclear bomb, while residents are grateful for employment it provides, arguing that lab's aims have expanded.
lead_paragraph: Protesters condemned the national laboratory here, which produced the first atomic bombs 70 years ago but also remains the town’s economic lifeblood.

headline.main: Peace Activists Descend on Los Alamos, but Residents Remain Indifferent
headline.print_headline: An Atomic Legacy Splits Peace Activists and Grateful Locals
